text: president obama alongside his family serving thanksgiving dinner to homeless wednesday night at friendship place in washington. nicholas kamm afp getty images president obama joined by his wife and daughters served thanksgiving dinner in d.c. shelter wednesday to highlight administration 's efforts to end homelessness among u.s veterans. first family visited friendship place which is located in basement of st. lukes church in northwest washington. shelter which received 3.1 million grant from department of veterans affairs this year to improve its capacity to address veteran homelessness operates program veterans first leading provider of housing services to veterans and their families in area that currently serves 550 households. obamas along with some friends served dinner as part of shelter 's feast with friends event. each member of family had assigned duties president served turkey and ladled gravy michelle obama distributed vegetables malia doled out mashed potatoes sasha gave out stuffing and cranberry sauce and marian robinson dished out macaroni and cheese. we appreciate you president said asking another how you been. obama also asked those partaking in meal if they preferred white or dark meat. white house which first launched effort to end homelessness in june 2010 has intensified its push targeting homeless veterans this year. mayors of 25 cities with largest populations of homeless veterans in nation have publicly pledged to end veteran homelessness in their communities by end of this year and virginia announced on veterans day it had become first state to end homelessness among those who have served in military. for one night trying to make each homeless person count homelessness among american veterans declined 36 percent between 2010 and january 2015 according to white house officials with unsheltered homelessness among veterans decreasing by 50 percent during that same period.
